fr:tree.fr:mainmatter: We define \text {Eq} by double induction on \mathbb {N}. By the first application of induction it suffices to provide \begin {align*} &E_0:\mathbb {N}\to \mathcal {U}_0 \\ &E_S:\mathbb {N}\to ((\mathbb {N}\to \mathcal {U}_0)\to (\mathbb {N}\to \mathcal {U}_0)) \end {align*} we define E_0 by induction: \begin {align*} &E_0(0) \equiv \textbf {1}\\ &E_0(\text {succ}(n)) \equiv \textbf {0} \end {align*} and also define E_S by induction: \begin {align*} &E_S(n,X,0)\equiv \textbf {0}\\ &E_S(n,X,\text {succ}(m))\equiv X(m) \end {align*} Therefore we have by the computation rule for the first induction that the following judgemental equality holds. \begin {align*} \text {Eq}(0,m) &\equiv E_0(m) \\ \text {Eq}(\text {succ}(n),m) &\equiv E_S(n,\text {Eq}(n),m) \end {align*}

fr:mainmatter.fr:p:
The observational equality of \mathbb {N} is a binary relation \text {Eq}_\mathbb {N}:\mathbb {N}\to (\mathbb {N}\to \mathcal {U}_0) satisfies \begin {align*} \text {Eq}_\mathbb {N}(0)(0) &\equiv \textbf {1} \\ \text {Eq}_\mathbb {N}(0)(\text {succ}(n)) &\equiv \textbf {0} \\ \text {Eq}_\mathbb {N}(\text {succ}(m))(0) &\equiv \textbf {0} \\ \text {Eq}_\mathbb {N}(\text {succ}(m))(\text {succ}(n)) &\equiv \text {Eq}_\mathbb {N}(m)(n) \end {align*}
785#319unstable-319.xmlProof We define \text {Eq} by double induction on \mathbb {N}. By the first application of induction it suffices to provide \begin {align*} &E_0:\mathbb {N}\to \mathcal {U}_0 \\ &E_S:\mathbb {N}\to ((\mathbb {N}\to \mathcal {U}_0)\to (\mathbb {N}\to \mathcal {U}_0)) \end {align*} we define E_0 by induction: \begin {align*} &E_0(0) \equiv \textbf {1}\\ &E_0(\text {succ}(n)) \equiv \textbf {0} \end {align*} and also define E_S by induction: \begin {align*} &E_S(n,X,0)\equiv \textbf {0}\\ &E_S(n,X,\text {succ}(m))\equiv X(m) \end {align*} Therefore we have by the computation rule for the first induction that the following judgemental equality holds. \begin {align*} \text {Eq}(0,m) &\equiv E_0(m) \\ \text {Eq}(\text {succ}(n),m) &\equiv E_S(n,\text {Eq}(n),m) \end {align*}
